channel.title: Cache Error V2 - Old Problems Fixed, New Problems Found ._
channel.description:
[center][b][size=24pt]EDIT:
MY LAST ISSUE HAS BEEN FIXED![/size]
Here's my new issue... [/b][/center] [B][CENTER] Hi, thanks for taking time out of your evening to view my thread!
All other errors were fixed thanks to a user named EmtScape!
I have fixed all the other cache issues I had, but now... Now I'm getting this error whenever I try to open my client. My cache file is named "ploxscape" and it DOES download, for only but a second, and then you see this error on the client and in the cmd too. Here's a picture:
If you can figure it out, or help, I'd appreciate it! Thanks a lot![/CENTER][/B]
[CENTER][URL=http://s328.photobucket.com/user/Brandon-FS/media/14Halp.png.html][IMG]http://i328.photobucket.com/albums/l333/Brandon-FS/14Halp.png[/img][/URL][/CENTER]

item.title: Cache Error V2 - Old Problems Fixed, New Problems Found ._
item.dc:creator: @PloxScape PloxScape
item.description:
@PloxScape wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:4, topic:535275”]I don’t think you zipped your cache correctly because it is missing those files it says on CMD.

  1. Locate cache folder

  2. Open cache folder

  3. Select All the cache files inside of the folder

  4. With all the files selected right click and choose add to archive… (Winrar)

  5. On archive type by default it is set at .rar change it to .zip

  6. Now re-upload cache to dropbox and then change the cache download link.[/quote]

Thank you for such a detailed tip! But unfortunately, it still didn’t work.

Read full topic
item.source: Cache Error V2 - Old Problems Fixed, New Problems Found ._

item.title: Cache Error V2 - Old Problems Fixed, New Problems Found ._
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

I don’t think you zipped your cache correctly because it is missing those files it says on CMD.

  1. Locate cache folder

  2. Open cache folder

  3. Select All the cache files inside of the folder

  4. With all the files selected right click and choose add to archive… (Winrar)

  5. On archive type by default it is set at .rar change it to .zip

  6. Now re-upload cache to dropbox and then change the cache download link.

Read full topic
item.source: Cache Error V2 - Old Problems Fixed, New Problems Found ._

item.title: Cache Error V2 - Old Problems Fixed, New Problems Found ._
item.dc:creator: @PloxScape PloxScape
item.description:
@PloxScape wrote:

[quote=“Bl3nd, post:2, topic:535275”]First, is the source running before you open the client.
Secondly, is the ip’s set to the correct ip?[/quote]

I thought of the same thing you did, and yes and yes, the IPs were set correctly and also I ran the server source after taking this picture and it did the same thing when I opened the client to play.

Read full topic
